Title: Duplicate declaration of data structures
Content:
There are two `Issuance` structs, [one defined in](https://github.com/dharmaprotocol/charta/blob/b110959477cf37375bf7e9344d40eb85219c8575/contracts/DebtKernel.sol#L98) [`DebtKernel`](https://github.com/dharmaprotocol/charta/blob/b110959477cf37375bf7e9344d40eb85219c8575/contracts/DebtKernel.sol#L98) and [another one in](https://github.com/dharmaprotocol/charta/blob/b110959477cf37375bf7e9344d40eb85219c8575/contracts/DebtRegistry.sol#L38) [`DebtRegistry`](https://github.com/dharmaprotocol/charta/blob/b110959477cf37375bf7e9344d40eb85219c8575/contracts/DebtRegistry.sol#L38), which are basically the same, except for [one member](https://github.com/dharmaprotocol/charta/blob/b110959477cf37375bf7e9344d40eb85219c8575/contracts/DebtKernel.sol#L106). This duplication could cause problems if the two data structure definitions ever get out of sync during development. Consider having one definition in a central place, together with the relevant operations defined as functions.


***Update:** Fixed in [0566271](https://github.com/dharmaprotocol/charta/commit/0566271b5ec86d318f49ab8346f9ad8ae5092b10).*
